required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Wyeth Study To Evaluate a 13-valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine in Infants
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomised,Active-Controlled ,Double-Blind Trial Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of Manufacturing Scale 13-valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety, tolerability and immunogenicity of manufacturing scale 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate (13vPnC) vaccine compared to pilot scale 13vPnC in healthy infants when given with routine pediatric vaccines.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Antibody Level ≥0.35μg/mL in 13vPnC Manufacturing Scale Group Relative to 13vPnC Pilot Scale Group After the 3-Dose Infant Series
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after 3-dose infant series (5 months of age)
primary_outcome.description: Percentages of participants achieving WHO predefined antibody threshold ≥0.35μg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Local Reactions
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day period after each dose
primary_outcome.description: Local reactions were reported using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant(Sig) (present and interfered with limb movement). Induration and erythema were scaled as Any (induration or erythema present); Mild (0.5 centimeters [cm] to 2.0 cm); Moderate (Mod) (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (> 7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Systemic Events (Infant Series)
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day period after each dose
primary_outcome.description: Systemic events (fever ≥ 38 degrees Celsius [C] but ≤ 39 C, fever >39 C but ≤ 40 C, fever > 40 C, decreased appetite, irritability, increased sleep, decreased sleep, use of medication (Meds)to prevent symptoms (sx), and use of medication to treat symptoms) were collected using an electronic diary. Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Systemic Events (Toddler Series)
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day period after toddler dose
primary_outcome.description: Systemic events (fever ≥ 38 degrees Celsius [C] but ≤ 39 C, fever >39 C but ≤ 40 C, fever > 40 C), decreased appetite, irritability, increased sleep, decreased sleep, use of medication to prevent symptoms, and use of medication to treat symptoms) were collected using an electronic diary. Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration in 13vPnC Manufacturing Scale Group Relative to 13vPnC Pilot Scale Group After the 3-Dose Infant Series
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after 3-dose infant series (5 months of age)
primary_outcome.description: Antibody concentration/geometric mean concentration (GMC) as measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.

intervention.description: 1 dose at 2,3,4 and 12 months of age

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Aged 2 months (42 to 98 days) at time of enrollment.
2. Available for entire study period and whose parent/legal guardian can be reached by telephone.
3. Healthy infant as determined by medical history, physical examination, and judgment of the investigator.
4. Parent/legal guardian must be able to complete all relevant study procedures during study participation.
Exclusion criteria:
1. Previous vaccination with licensed or investigational pneumococcal, Hib conjugate, diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, or polio vaccines.
2. A previous anaphylactic reaction to any vaccine or vaccine-related component.
3. Contraindication to vaccination with Hib conjugate, diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, polio, hepatitis B, measles, mumps, rubella, or pneumococcal vaccines.
4. Bleeding diathesis or condition associated with prolonged bleeding time that would contraindicate intramuscular injection.
5. Known or suspected immune deficiency or suppression.
6. History of culture-proven invasive disease caused by S pneumoniae.
7. Major known congenital malformation or serious chronic disorders.
8. Significant neurological disorder or history of seizure including febrile seizure, or significant stable or evolving disorders such as cerebral palsy, encephalopathy, hydrocephalus, or other significant disorders. Does not include resolving syndromes due to birth trauma such as Erb palsy.
9. Receipt of blood products or gamma-globulin (including hepatitis B immunoglobulin and monoclonal antibodies; eg, Synagis®).
10. Participation in another investigational or interventional trial. Participation in purely observational studies is acceptable.
11. Infant who is a direct descendant (child or grandchild) of a member of the study site personnel.

overall_official.affiliation: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited in Poland from June 2007 to August 2007.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants were enrolled into the study according to inclusion/exclusion criteria without a screening period.

group.title: 13vPnC Manufacturing
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL manufacturing scale dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with combined diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b vaccine (DTaP-IPV-Hib) and hepatitis B virus vaccine (HBV) at 2 months (infant series, dose 1). Participants received one single 0.5mL manufacturing scale dose of 13vPnC coadministered with DTaP-IPV-Hib at 3 and 4 months (infant series, dose 2 and 3). Participants received one single 0.5mL manufacturing scale dose of 13vPnC coadministered with measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine (MMR) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

group.title: 13vPnC Pilot
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL pilot scale dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with combined diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b vaccine (DTaP-IPV-Hib) and hepatitis B virus vaccine (HBV) at 2 months (infant series, dose 1). Participants received one single 0.5mL pilot scale dose of 13vPnC coadministered with DTaP-IPV-Hib at 3 and 4 months (infant series, dose 2 and 3). Participants received one single 0.5mL pilot scale dose of 13vPnC coadministered with measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine (MMR) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

group.title: 13vPnC Manufacturing
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL manufacturing scale dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with combined diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b vaccine (DTaP-IPV-Hib) and hepatitis B virus vaccine (HBV) at 2 months (infant series, dose 1). Participants received one single 0.5mL manufacturing scale dose of 13vPnC coadministered with DTaP-IPV-Hib at 3 and 4 months (infant series, dose 2 and 3). Participants received one single 0.5mL manufacturing scale dose of 13vPnC coadministered with measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine (MMR) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

group.title: 13vPnC Pilot
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL pilot scale dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with combined diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b vaccine (DTaP-IPV-Hib) and hepatitis B virus vaccine (HBV) at 2 months (infant series, dose 1). Participants received one single 0.5mL pilot scale dose of 13vPnC coadministered with DTaP-IPV-Hib at 3 and 4 months (infant series, dose 2 and 3). Participants received one single 0.5mL pilot scale dose of 13vPnC coadministered with measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine (MMR) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Antibody Level ≥0.35μg/mL in 13vPnC Manufacturing Scale Group Relative to 13vPnC Pilot Scale Group After the 3-Dose Infant Series
outcome.description: Percentages of participants achieving WHO predefined antibody threshold ≥0.35μg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
outcome.time_frame: One month after 3-dose infant series (5 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population consisting of eligible participants who adhered to protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

analysis.groups_desc: For serotype 4 the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC Manufacturing - 13vPnC Pilot) was calculated
For serotype 6B the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC Manufacturing - 13vPnC Pilot) was calculated
For serotype 9V the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC Manufacturing - 13vPnC Pilot) was calculated
For serotype 14 the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC Manufacturing - 13vPnC Pilot) was calculated
For serotype 18C the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC Manufacturing - 13vPnC Pilot) was calculated
For serotype 19F the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC Manufacturing - 13vPnC Pilot) was calculated
For serotype 23F the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC Manufacturing - 13vPnC Pilot) was calculated
For serotype 1 the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC Manufacturing - 13vPnC Pilot) was calculated
For serotype 3 the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC Manufacturing - 13vPnC Pilot) was calculated
For serotype 5 the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC Manufacturing - 13vPnC Pilot) was calculated
For serotype 6A the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC Manufacturing - 13vPnC Pilot) was calculated
For serotype 7F the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC Manufacturing - 13vPnC Pilot) was calculated
For serotype 19A the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC Manufacturing - 13vPnC Pilot) was calculated

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Local Reactions
outcome.description: Local reactions were reported using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant(Sig) (present and interfered with limb movement). Induration and erythema were scaled as Any (induration or erythema present); Mild (0.5 centimeters [cm] to 2.0 cm); Moderate (Mod) (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (> 7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day period after each dose
outcome.population: The safety population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of vaccine; (n) = number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration in 13vPnC Manufacturing Scale Group Relative to 13vPnC Pilot Scale Group After the 3-Dose Infant Series
outcome.description: Antibody concentration/geometric mean concentration (GMC) as measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
outcome.time_frame: One month after 3-dose infant series (5 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population were participants who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC Manufacturing
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL manufacturing scale dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 2, 3, 4 months (infant series) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

group.title: 13vPnC Pilot
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL pilot scale dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 2, 3, 4 months (infant series) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

measure.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration in 13vPnC Manufacturing Scale Group Relative to 13vPnC Pilot Scale Group After the 3-Dose Infant Series
measure.description: Antibody concentration/geometric mean concentration (GMC) as measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
measure.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population were participants who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC Manufacturing Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL manufacturing scale dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with combined diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b vaccine (DTaP-IPV-Hib) and hepatitis B virus vaccine (HBV) at 2 months (infant series, dose 1). Participants received one single 0.5mL manufacturing scale dose of 13vPnC coadministered with DTaP-IPV-Hib at 3 and 4 months (infant series, dose 2 and 3).

group.title: 13vPnC Pilot Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL pilot scale dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with combined diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b vaccine (DTaP-IPV-Hib) and hepatitis B virus vaccine (HBV) at 2 months (infant series, dose 1). Participants received one single 0.5mL pilot scale dose of 13vPnC coadministered with DTaP-IPV-Hib at 3 and 4 months (infant series, dose 2 and 3).

group.title: 13vPnC Manufacturing Post-Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL manufacturing scale dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with combined diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b vaccine (DTaP-IPV-Hib) and hepatitis B virus vaccine (HBV) at 2 months (infant series, dose 1). Participants received one single 0.5mL manufacturing scale dose of 13vPnC coadministered with DTaP-IPV-Hib at 3 and 4 months (infant series, dose 2 and 3). Assessment done at 5 months of age, 1 month after infant series.

group.title: 13vPnC Pilot Post-Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL pilot scale dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with combined diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b vaccine (DTaP-IPV-Hib) and hepatitis B virus vaccine (HBV) at 2 months (infant series, dose 1). Participants received one single 0.5mL pilot scale dose of 13vPnC coadministered with DTaP-IPV-Hib at 3 and 4 months (infant series, dose 2 and 3). Assessment done at 5 months of age, 1 month after infant series.

group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL manufacturing scale dose of 13vPnC coadministered with measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine (MMR) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL pilot scale dose of 13vPnC coadministered with measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine (MMR) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PIs agreed to allow the sponsor 60 days to review and require changes to presentations or publications but only to protect confidential information and intellectual property, and for the sponsor to file a patent application, as applicable. The PIs also agreed for data to be presented first as a joint, multi-center publication.
